author: Hadlee Simons
title: Better mobile cameras than iPhone 6s?
text:
Are you covered? Compare quotes for car, life and business insurance right now! 
Sign up for your free fax number and get faxes sent to your inbox! Better mobile cameras than iPhone 6s? Article By: Hadlee Simons Fri, 16 Oct 2015 10:03 AM Share Your Email 
Popular photography website DxOMark has reviewed the iPhone 6s camera, giving it a positive review. 
The iPhone 6s received a score of 82, tying it with the iPhone 6 and 6 Plus (although the bar graph showed it to be slightly lower than the older phones). 
However, the website ranked several Android smartphones above Apple's latest and greatest. 
The top three cameras belonged to the Sony Xperia Z5 (87), Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge (86) and the Google Nexus 6P (84). 
The top three were followed by the LG G4 (83), Samsung Galaxy Note 4 (83), the Moto X Style (83) and the Sony Xperia Z3 Plus (82). 
"Strong competition from rivals means that the Apple iPhone 6s actually moves down in our rankings. The Moto X Style and Google's Nexus 6P bracket the 6s on performance, but are significantly cheaper to own," the website explained. 
"Apple's technology is unable to keep noise at competitive levels; in fact, noise level is much higher than what can be found on the current leaders of our database," it said, but added that details in bright light have improved. 
Otherwise, the site reported that the latest iPhone has the same strengths and weaknesses as its predecessor. 
Read the full review on the DxOMark website . Read More
